intro: Moringa streptocarpa, commonly known as the African horseradish or Indian gooseberry, is a shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its alternate, pinnately compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that develop into fleshy, orange-red fruits. The plant thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun for optimal growth. It is drought-tolerant and can be propagated through seeds or cuttings. Its botanical features make it adaptable to various climates and suitable for both ornamental and medicinal use.
